page.title: 05THE RIVER DARENT: A STUDY
page.content: There are 2 distinct profiles to this river: at{Court Lodge}it is 12 m. wide, sloping gently to a maximum depth of 22 cms.; at the lakes, it is 6m. wide, with steep banks, dipping sharply to a depth of 19 cms. on the left bank, to a maximum depth of 20 cms. At{Court Lodge}the river was timed as flowing at a rate of 400m. per hour; at the lakes the rate of flow is 2400m. per hour. River temperatures varied by only 1 degree at{Court Lodge}(centre 14C, edge 15C) but by 5 degrees at the lakes (centre 10C, edge 15C). Some pollution evidence exists in plastic bottles, car tyres, crisp packets - the results of the extensive use of the river by anglers, picnickers and local people.
